alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 22 at 6:56PM AKST until February 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow, blowing snow and freezing rain will continue this afternoon and tonight. Winds will increase late Thursday morning with blizzard conditions expected to develop early Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
